QuestionStem: Bonsai trees are plants that have been "trained" using the art of trimming and shaping. They can be grown from seeds or cuttings. Which statements are true about bonsai trees? Select all that apply.

options.AnswerText: A. Bonsai trees do not need the same light, water, and nutrients required by the plant species.
B. Bonsai trees need the same light, water, and nutrients required by the plant species.
C. Bonsai trees can reproduce sexually and asexually.
D. Bonsai trees can reproduce sexually but not asexually.

CorrectFeedback: Bonsai trees are plants that have been physically altered, so they have the same requirements for growth as full-sized plants. Reproduction using seeds is sexual; reproduction using cuttings is asexual.
PartiallyCorrectFeedback: Bonsai trees have the same genetic and environmental requirements as the plant species.
IncorrectFeedback: Bonsai trees have the same genetic and environmental requirements as the plant species.
FinalIncorrectFeedback: Bonsai trees are plants that have been physically altered, so they have the same requirements for growth as full-sized plants. Reproduction using seeds is sexual; reproduction using cuttings is asexual.

image.altText: In this photograph, a very small, but mature-appearing tree grows in a clay pot.
